title: IKEA’s Classic Blue Bags Are About to Look Very Different â€” See the New Design
text:
The iconic big blue-and-yellowÂ IKEA bag is getting a makeover that rivals even the most impressive of before-and-afters.
The Swedish giantâ€™s 99-cent FRAKTA bag, perfect forÂ toting a multitude of inexpensive home goods while you shop (and your laundry for yearsÂ after), is getting a new look, thanks to a collaboration with the French retailer, Colette and theirÂ Creative Director, Sarah Andelman.
The polypropylene recyclable carry-all currently boasts its hardworking blue base with yellow handles, but Coletteâ€™s take gives the tote a fresh white makeover featuring with the European brandâ€™s signature blue polka dots.

Although the collection wonâ€™t be available in US stores until 2018, visitors lucky enough to have access to the Parisian spot can pick up the refreshed shopper (and even get one forÂ free with the purchase of any IKEAâ€™s Art Event collection pieces, also available at Colette) from now until May 6th. While youâ€™re there, take note of the collaborationâ€™s other events , including an exhibit of limited-edition posters, live performances, and a reinvention of the shopâ€™s waterbar , which is exactly what it sounds like.
Regardless of whether youâ€™re excitedÂ for the reimagined design or would prefer to keep things classic, thereâ€™s no arguing that this largeÂ storageÂ saviorÂ is an essential part of the IKEA experience. Because if you goÂ to IKEA and donâ€™tÂ leave with a bag full of tea lights, did you really go at all?
